answers.answer: anyway you'd be able to get your bp checked? i had to have a c-section at 36 weeks due to preeclampsia. it is a very serious condition. when's the last time you were at the doctor? did they mention your bp and whether or not you had protein in your urine at that point? i don't want to scare you, but some of your symptoms raise alarms. if you can, go to a pharmacy with one of those machines and have your bp checked. if it's high i would call your dr soon. i did not have the abdominal pain, nor the vision pain. this condition can be managed for weeks, or it can worsen and get dangerous quickly.

I was on hospitalized bed rest due to preterm labor, and every time the nurse came in, they would ask me if I had any of those symptoms...they can lead to very serious complications. I would get to the doc asap!!! Especially because of the vision changes!

i had preeclamsia(toxemia) with my first...that was 12yrs ago. i started with severe weight gain and protein in the urine at every doc check-up. i spent most of my last 4 months in and out of the hospital. it can be VERY serious if not properly treated. i was on complete bedrest for the last month at the hospital. couldn't even get up to go potty or shower for that matter. i had an emergency c-section after many failed attempts to get me induced. i had liver, kidneys, lungs and heart problems due to that and it was starting to affect the baby and that is why they took him out. everything worked out fine. i had blurred vision and sometimes blind spells. be really careful with those symptoms and don't wait it out. go to the hospital. it is better to be safe than sorry. take care of yourself and your baby...he/she is counting on you...even if you get sent back.

you should go to hospital to get your bp checked asap because the stress of worrying you might have it might push it up, i hd it and was in hospital for 2 weeks before ds was born at 35 weeks . please nip in get checked as it can be life threatening .good luck x x

I was also on hospitalized bed rest (36.1 days) due to low amniotic fluid and matured placenta. Every time any one comes in to check me they ask me about all the symptoms u have been having. So u better talk to someone
Just wanted to check up on you and see how you're feeling today...did you go to the pharmacy or anywhere to get your blood pressure checked?

Nikki! Are you ok? I realize it is the weekend and is still kinda early, so maybe you're sleeping but I'm about freaking out here since you haven't gotten back on! Keep us updated! Hope all goes well!

I'm heading to the pharmacy to check my bp in a bit.  I need to read up about what I am looking for in the normal bp range.  Everytime I've been to the doc they say I have excellent blood pressure.  I havent been for 3 weeks though (i know most docs see you at every 2 weeks up to this point but not mine he's wonderful like Rubyolivia's).  I go to him Tuesday.So assuming my bp is normal at walgreens today, I am going to wonder if I'm having something else go on that I will def. have to bring up at the docs.  I have been having very sleepless nights... last night I kept waking up smelling things.  First it was popcorn, then it was a very strong fruit smell... like mango ice cream or something I dont know.  Then there as something else but I didn't say that one out loud to my husband so I forget.  That has to be hormones!  Around the middle of hte night I wandered to the couch again ... I was having bad cramps, not contractions I dont think... felt like menstral cramps down low and not the way they describe contractions coming up high into your uterus.  I just don't know what I'm lookign for.Also, I've had no sudden weight gain.  I've gained maybe 5 lbs in the last 3 weeks... which isnt great but I did that once before too.  I dunno, I'll have to read up on what I am looking for at the blood pressure machine and go check it out.  Will kep you updated.Jess, I'm ok :)  If I go to the hospital, I am taking our friend the laptop so you'll know :)

If you go to the store to check your BP, it is very important to rest in the chair for at least 5 minutes prior to taking any reading.  If you get a high reading, sit there for at LEAST 5 more minutes to check it again.We get ladies all the time who get their pressures checked at the store places and have to then come in to rule out preeclampsia.  Most of the time, when they get here and we have them rest on their sides, their pressures are fine.That said, if you are having headaches unchanged by Tylenol, vision changes, rapid increase in weight over a weeks time, marked swelling in your extremities (especially in your hands and face) or right upper quadrant pain, dark urine...you do definately need to let your doctor know, even on a weekend.  Its not a bad idea to check your pressure at the store, but only if you rest at least 5 minutes prior, and check it again after resting.

Here was my BP at CVS.  I didn't rest for a full 5 minutes but was rather relaxed after carefully reading the directons and did it twice due to confusion the first time trying to read the legend.  I did not come out with high blood pressure... Rather on the low end.  I read that 120/80 is idea for a pregant woman.  I am unsure of how much deviation there is for this per person but here are my readings:Systolic 107Diastolic 69Heartbeats/min 88I know the 88 sounds normal, how about the rest?  And my urine HAS been very dark but I've been figuring I wasn't getting enough fluid and am trying to drink more.  I've not taken any tylenol for the headaches as they arent all that common and I never feel as if it does anything for me anyway.

Glad you're ok! :)Your bp sounds good actually! I think the norm for women who aren't pregnant is 110/70. Mine always runs really close to that. I don't know about the hearbeat, but mine was 79 the other night when I checked it at WalMart.I guess maybe I should have brought this up BEFORE you went to the store! lol But, you can buy the strips that they use at the doctor's office to check your urine for protein. My pharmacy has them for 50 cents a strip and you can also get the ones that check for sugar/glucose/whatever in the urine too.And I may be stupid....but I didn't know REAL contractions came up high into your uterus. If that's the case, I think I've had a few. I get reeeeeally big waves of ache right below my ribs lately and was wondering what was happening. Maybe it is contractions...hmmm! lol I thought they were more like the cramps that you are having! Gosh....I'll give birth before I realize I'm in labor and get to the hospital if I continue to be so ignorant! lol

I would think your bp would have to be high too in order for it to be preeclampsia. I don't really know much about it other than the symptoms.  Maybe you could also google symptoms of gestational diabetes. I don't know if that would make you feel so "off' like you are, but maybe! (???) I don't even know if that can kick in this late, but hey! lolI am also going the the "you'll know" theory when it comes to contractions. Hope it works! lol My cousin is getting married today and dh does NOT want to go to the wedding at all. He keeps saying, "can you please just go into labor?" AS IF I have control of that! Jeesh!

Jess, don't listen to me about what "real" contractions are.  I havent the slightest.  I knwo when i have bh contractions they are where it hardens clear up into my belly and not pain just in the pelvis.  All I know is everyone tells me "you'll know" when you are having real contractions.  I've heard they feel like bad menstral cramps, I have heard you feel them in your back, I have even heard you feel like you have to poo.  I have no idea... I just keep trying to go with the "you'll know" reassurance lol.I talked to my friend who is a nurse.  She didn't really know what was normal for prego women but she thought my bp sounded fine too.  I am sure it would have to be high for this to be preeclampsia.  That was one thing I couldnt wrap my mind around was the fact that I've continued to have such good BP so that would pretty much rule it out.  I dont know what is with the dizziness and the vision change that day and the headaches that are rare but very strong.  Maybe it's all hormones.  Darn hormones!

LOL you can always have a "false" labor haha.  I know you would feel guilty though.  I'm getting into this very frustrated with being pregnant state.  People keep asking me when my due date is and I just say "any day now" instead of the 29th.  Haha... that's like well over 2 weeks away if not 3!  But I just don't want to go all the way to then... I know I"m cursed to go over, I just know it.Did you see where I wrote about how I was waking up smelling weird things?  It was by far the most bizarre thing that has happened during this pregnancy!  To wake up to a totally strong smell of popcorn and then not much later to a very strong fruity smell... It was so weird!  These hormones are hijacking my body and I want them to be done!  I dreamt last night that I had Leah and everywhere I went I just couldnt put her down.  Not even to go into her carrier... I just wanted to hold her everywhere!  I didnt even want to put her down to go pee in a stall!  It was a strange dream and she was soooo tiny in the dream.  I also kept nursing her but feeling like nothing was coming out and that was why she was so small... I wasnt producing milk.  WEIRD!

I would feel guilty if I didn't go. Plus, my mom would know what I was up to! lol Besides, they are doing everything themselves (to save money...but ended up spending 3 grand more than my parents did and we had lots of things hired out lol) and my mom swears it will be the ugliest wedding I've ever witnessed! So I'm anxious to see if she's right! (We're horrible)did read about your wierd "smelling attack"! lol It's funny because I woke up the other night smelling popcorn and thought I was going nuts. Turned out Jeremy had made popcorn like an hour before that and I was just too knocked out to know.I also have alot of Max dreams! Makes me so mad because I can always see his hair and all his little features...even see him wearing the clothes I've bought for him. But I can NEVER see his face! One time (the day I got my BFP) I dreamed about him and saw his little face...before I even knew he was a boy! I've remembered that face though so I'll be stunned if he looks anything like the dream!

I didn't realize it was your side of the family and dh doesnt want to go.  thought it was his side.  Yeah you have to go :(.  Yeah Terry def. had not made any popcorn before I smelled it.  We rarely make popcorn.Are max's movements still pretty frequent?  Leahs are getting less and less.  I play her baby einstein cd to my belly and she'll move around for certain tracks.  I always wonder if she moves to them beause she likes them or hates them and wants them to stop lol.  Poor baby.  Some of them are kind of upbeat and I wonder if they bug her haha.  But they let me know she's ok in there!

Back from the wedding! Not too bad...but I must say...mine was better! lolYeah Max's movements are still frequent but he's definately getting bigger! It feels like he's running out of room in there! I always feel body parts (feet, knees elbows) jabbing me! I gave him a little talk today and told him that anytime he wanted to come out from this day forward would be just fine. lol I went into all sorts of good reasons why it's better on the outside of the belly! I have had  a few contractions this evening so maybe they'll get more regular! (ha!)

are your symptoms better?i researched preeclampsia a lot when i suspected i had it. i thought i should mention to you that there are cases where it is NOT accompanied by high blood pressure. your bp numbers looked good, especially for this stage in pregnancy. but if your symptoms continue despite drinking lots of fluids, please call the doctor just in case. like others said, the symptoms you described are the ones they constantly asked me if i had when i was in the hospital.hope you're feeling better. keep us updated

I am still feeling a bit funny an am trying to keep drinking a lot but will occassionally feel dizzy.  I havent had issues with the eyes in the last couple of days but have had a headache here and there.  I go to the doc on tuesday and do plan to talk to him about it all then.  I wonder if my body is just having the flu like symptoms that labor is coming soon.  I keep losing more and more mucous here and there when I go tot he rest room (sorry TMI) and can't help but wonder if I'm dialating.  I've been having some very rough nights and getting very little sleep which could be contributing to the exhaustion as well.  Thanks for asking!

don not be fooled by your blood presure even if it is good mine was always good and i had all of the other symptoms of preeclampsia i discussed this with my doctor and he assured me that because my blood pressure was fine i did not have toxemia 2 days later I was flown to the University of Kentucky where I was diagnosed with toxemia and my daughter was almost dead please if you feel you have toxemia trust your instincts and make them do bloodwork to find out they have to do the bloodwork if you insist on it by the way my baby is now a 5 year old beatiful healthy girl

question: has anyone had this?  I have been having a few symptoms that are odd and someone mentioned it may be preeclampsia.  I never looked into it but tonight I read warning signs and am startled to have quite a few. I'm 36 weeks and 2 days.First, I am swelling like mad... which I've been attributing to the heat and water retention.Second, I've been having vision changes or more like a vision pain that causes a severe headache.  This has only happened twice, yesterday being the first time.Third, I've been seeing strange flashes of light.  I will look aroudn the room and see what appears to be glitter all around me.  this is the weirdest symptom.  Me, I'm so ditzy I've just been like, Oh look at the pretty glitter light things and they go away after a around 30 seconds or so.  This has happeend around 3 times in the past week.  I couldnt believe when I read that this was a symptom.I go to the doc on Tuesday.  It's the weekend now and he doesnt work mondays (go figure I always have questions after the weekend) so I have to wait until then to talk to him.  I am home alone all day tomorrow as DH is working all day.  I plan to take it really easy, drink lots of fluid, and try and wait it out till I can see my doc on tuesday.  do you think this will be alright?  she's moving in there and seems ok and I just pretty much am couch ridden.One other symptom was severe pain in the upper abdominal area.  I'm not having that.
title: Preeclampsia?
